benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: PUT Valid Request: Multiple success paths with 204, including required (X-Killbill-CreatedBy) and optional headers, and different bundle states (with/without existing fields).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 when bundle is not found (TC05).
Input Validation: 400s for invalid bundleId format, malformed JSON, missing body, unsupported body fields, and missing required header (TC04, TC06–TC09).
Server/Error Handling: 500/503 for integration/dependency failures (TC11, TC20).
Security/Robustness: SQL injection attempt rejected; special characters accepted as per regression (TC12, TC19).
Boundary Conditions: Max number of fields, max value length, empty value, and empty array to remove all fields (TC03, TC13–TC15).
Performance/Resilience: Normal and peak load performance; retry succeeds after transient failure (TC17, TC18, TC21).
Partial Update (positive path): Scenario for partial/partial matching updates (TC24).
gaps: Concurrency Issues: No scenarios for simultaneous updates to the same bundle, conflict detection, or last-write-wins vs optimistic locking (e.g., 409 with ETag/If-Match).
Idempotency of PUT: No test that repeating the exact same request leaves state unchanged and still returns 204.
Partial Update Semantics: Unclear replace-vs-merge behavior for PUT; no negative case if partial updates are not allowed; no tests for whether unspecified fields are removed or retained.
CustomField Schema Validation: No negative tests for missing/invalid fields, type mismatches, duplicate keys, nulls, or invalid objectType/targetKey; no over-limit negative cases.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No tests for Content-Type requirements (415 on wrong/missing), Accept negotiation (406), or asserting no response body on 204 and correct headers.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized user/tenant.
Audit Headers Behavior: No tests that X-Killbill-Reason/Comment lengths/characters are validated and persisted to audit; no limits validation.
Large Payload Handling: No tests for exceeding max number/size leading to 400/413.
State Rules: Background mentions inactive bundles but no explicit scenario verifying allowed/blocked updates for inactive/suspended bundles.
Spec Consistency: Story lists produces application/json with 204; no verification of header behavior vs no-body responses.
recommendations: Add concurrency tests: two users updating the same bundle concurrently; verify final state and conflict handling (e.g., 409 with If-Match/version) or documented last-write-wins.
Add idempotency test: send identical PUT twice; assert same state and 204 both times; no duplicate fields created.
Clarify and codify PUT semantics (replace vs merge). Add tests for full replacement, merging behavior, and rejection if partial not allowed; verify handling of unspecified fields.
Expand schema validation: missing/invalid CustomField fields, type errors, duplicate keys, nulls, invalid objectType/target, and values exceeding limits -> appropriate error codes.
Add content negotiation tests: require Content-Type: application/json (415 on wrong/missing), Accept not supported (406); assert 204 has no body and correct headers.
Add authorization/permissions scenarios: 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized users/tenants.
Add negative boundary tests: exceed max fields/value length and overall payload size (expect 400/413).
Validate audit headers: reason/comment persistence to audit logs and length/charset constraints.
Add explicit test for inactive/suspended bundle behavior per business rules (allowed vs blocked with clear status code).
Verify response headers per spec on success and error (e.g., Content-Type presence/absence, request-id); ensure behavior aligns with produces/application-json and 204 semantics.
